titles.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to establish and provide a checkoff for a World Trade Center Memorial Fund, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on Resources, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to House Ways and Means
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks.

committee.subcommittee: National Parks, Recreation, and Public Lands
committee.name: House Resources

bill.summary: 3/3/2005--Introduced. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to: (1) establish in the Treasury a World Trade Center Memorial Fund for the purpose of making grants to the World Trade Center Memorial Foundation for the construction of a memorial at the former site of the World Trade Center in New York City; and (2) permit taxpayers to designate on their tax returns $1.00 ($2.00 for joint returns) of their tax liability to the World Trade Center Memorial Fund.
